reaction and bromination ShiqiÂ Fu, GangÂ Liu, SenÂ Liu, ZongyinÂ Gao, ShuoÂ Tao, YuanÂ Peng, NanaÂ Xin, XianqiangÂ Huang and GuopingÂ Yang The copper-bonded polyoxomolybdates-based framework (CPF-1) exhibits highly efficient heterogeneous catalytic activities in tandem click and bromination reactions (yields of up to 99 %). Furthermore, CPF-1 can be easily recovered and reused without significant loss of activity after seven reaction cycles. 114215 Rational design of multi-component Fe(OH)3/Ni-NiO heterostructures bifunctional catalyst for electrochemical water splitting JuanÂ Zeng, MaoÂ Peng, YanzhaoÂ Dong, MinghuiÂ Huang, WenqingÂ Jin, LiuyunÂ Lai, ChengchengÂ Li, QingxinÂ Wu, WeihanÂ Shu, YalongÂ Song, JinliÂ Zhang, AiqunÂ Kong, JieÂ Li and HaiyangÂ Zhang We fabricate a novel hybrid catalyst with three-phase heterojunction (Fe(OH)3/Ni-NiO) via a simple electrodeposition and chemical precipitation method. by whole cells of engineered Escherichia coli YangyangÂ Ji, YunfengÂ Cui, XiangtaoÂ Liu, JianjiongÂ Li, PeiyuanÂ Yao, QingÂ Zhao, QiaqingÂ Wu and DunmingÂ Zhu Contents 114233 Unraveling NH3-SCR performance and the role of Fe and Cu over the supported TNU-9 catalysts ZhenÂ Zhang, JinxingÂ Cui, ZhifangÂ Li, RuichaoÂ Yang, JiaoÂ Zhao, HanyuÂ Liu, ZhengzhongÂ Chen, YuanyuanÂ Ma and ChanglongÂ Yang Fe and Cu bimetallic modified TNU-9 catalysts were prepared by solution ion-exchanged method. The glorious catalyst, Cu-2Fe/T9 synthesized via exchanging Cu first for twice and then Fe for once, demonstrates outstanding catalytic performance due to minimizing the oxidation of Fe2+. Interestingly, Cu-2Fe/T9 has better the resistance of SO2 due to Fe protecting the active site Cu and the sulfation providing more strong acidic sites. 114187 Fabrication of N/K-doped TiO2-Ag nanospheres with efficient charge transfer for enhanced photocatalytic CO2 reduction into CH4 YinanÂ Ren and WeiÂ Li 114228 Electrochemically promoted C(sp3)â€“C(sp2) bond formation via radical/radical anion cross-coupling MingchunÂ Wang, AoÂ Song, XiupengÂ Wang, QingchenÂ Xiong, ZhaopengÂ Li, XiangyanÂ Shen, RongzhouÂ Wang and HailinÂ Cong 114238 Sequence-guided design for enhancing the thermal stability of a nucleoside hydrolase and its utilization in guanine production WenjieÂ Xu, ZonglinÂ Li and ZhiminÂ Li Contents 114227 Heteronuclear bicentric ionic liquids tailored for moderate catalytic conversion of CO2 into cyclic carbonates IrfanÂ Shabbir, JeanÂ DamasceneÂ Ndayambaje, LiÂ Dong, QianÂ Su and WeiguoÂ Cheng Synopsis Novel bicentric dual-functionalized pyridinium-based ionic liquid catalysts were synthesized and utilized for CO2 conversion into cyclic carbonates under moderate conditions. 114237 Synergistic effect of Cu and Fe on g-C3N4 for selective oxidation of methane to C1 products ZhengÂ Zhou, MengÂ Miao, WenzhiÂ Li, JingtingÂ Jin, LiqunÂ Wang, LuluÂ Zhang and LiangÂ Yuan REVIEW PAPERS 114196 Progress, challenges, and prospects with electrocatalyst (From transition metal oxides to dual-atom catalysts) for oxygen reduction reaction TeddyÂ Mageto, SanketÂ Bhoyate, AnujÂ Kumar and RamÂ K.Â Gupta 114225 Electrochemical CO2 reduction of graphene single-atom/cluster catalysts YongzeÂ Gao, MengdieÂ Zhao, LiyunÂ Jiang and QiÂ Yu We have summarized the electrochemical CO2RR by various graphene SACs/SCCs such as nitrogen-doped graphene, defect modified graphene, defect graphene and carbon nanotubes. Additionally, the reaction mechanisms for CO2RR and the pathways to diverse products are discussed in details. Finally, the potential opportunities and prospects of utilizing graphene SACs/SCCs for CO2RR are presented.
